page.title: 09TEYNHAM PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: Teynham Church of England Primary School lies just north of the A2. The present building replaced the original 19th Century structure about 11 years ago. It is a single-storey building of light construction, standing in what was formerly a cherry orchard. The school has a large playing field, part of which will shortly be sold for the building of a Parish hall. At present there are approximately 290 children attending the school, aged between 5 and 11. The majority live close to the school on housing estates built in the 1960s. Most of these houses are semi-detached. A number of pupils live in Conyer, about two miles away. The staff comprises ten teachers and a headmistress. An unusual feature of the school is its use as a church on Sundays.
